body.header:
Read this sample answer to the writing task in the previous exercise and find the mistakes. There are 15. Click on them.
Writing Task 2

div.p: The growth of tourism means that nowadays most countries have a tourist industry and for many countries it is an essential sector of their economy. However, like any major industry, tourism may have some drawbacks, I strongly oppose that it rarely benefits countries. On the contrast, I am in favour of, for a number of reasons, the vast majority of countries derive great benefit from it.

Another reason is that tourism provides regular employment for many local people who might otherwise be unemployed. They can find work in restaurants or hotels, or with tourist agencies as guides or drivers, for example, and earn regular wages. This, on the other hand, means that they may be able to save money and improve their standard of living.

The main reason is that tourists spend money in the country and this allows local businesses as restaurants, bars and taxi companies to flourish. In turn, other businesses, food suppliers or petrol stations, including, may be established in order to provide services to support the companies which cater for tourists. In other words, the whole economy of the region develops.

A final reason is that in order for tourists to be able to visit remote areas, roads, airports and hotels have to be built and local people also benefit by being able to use these new facilities. Furthermore, when communications improve, it becomes possible for other industries to move into the area, bringing with them more employment opportunities and increased prosperity.

A second reason why I am against tourism is that visitors from outside bring fresh ideas and different ways of doing things to the local community. For example, local people may learn from tourists. In contrast, visitors learn about the local people and culture, and return home with a deeper understanding of the host country.
In conclusion, I firmly support that governments should encourage tourism because of the opportunities it offers for ordinary people to improve their quality of life.

p.b: On the contrast -> On the contrary

p.font: We say 'in contrast' and 'on the contrary'. However, they do not mean the same thing!

p.b: I am in favour of -> I am convinced that

section.p: 'in favour of' needs to be followed by a gerund or noun.
This is the first reason mentioned by the writer.

p.b: on the other hand -> in turn

section.p: The writer is adding another comment supporting the previous idea.

p.b: The main reason -> The second reason

section.p: The 'main' reason has already been discussed in the first paragraph.
'including' should come before the example is given, not after it i.e. 'including food suppliers'.

p.b: A final reason -> A further reason

section.p: This is not the writer's final argument.

p.b: A second reason -> A final reason

section.p: 'support' needs to be followed by a noun or gerund.
